alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Seneca; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 1:22AM EDT until April 01 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Seneca County in northwestern Ohio... Wyandot County in northwestern Ohio... Crawford County in north central Ohio... * Until 200 AM EDT. * At 122 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fostoria to Arcadia to near Dunkirk, moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Tiffin, Fostoria, Bucyrus, Upper Sandusky, Galion, Crestline, Forest, Green Springs, New Washington, Bloomville, Sycamore, Morral, New Riegel, Chatfield, Marseilles, Carey, Attica, Benton, Nevada and Bettsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
